author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Madras High Court has directed the State government to provide the logbook relating to the Chembarambakkam Reservoir showing the water levels during the period from November 29 to December 2, 2015 within three weeks.

The First Bench headed by the Chief Justice S.K. Kaul passed the direction on a Public Interest Litigation appeal moved by industrialist Rajiv Rai seeking to appoint a high-power committee headed by a retired judge of the Supreme Court to ascertain the reasons for the recent flood.

On Thursday, the petitioner’s counsel submitted that there had been no practical compliance of the National Disaster Management Act, guidelines on preparation of State Disaster Management Plans and the guidelines on flood management by the State government.

He further stated that the compendium of flood rules of Anaicut and Reservoirs would be required to assist the court.

The Bench then posted the PIL to April 13 for further hearing.
title: Madras HC seeks logbook of Chembarambakkam lake
